metadata.Title: CVE-2020-26935 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in SearchController in phpMyAdmin before 4.9.6 and 5.x before 5.0.3. A SQL injection vulnerability was discovered in how phpMyAdmin processes SQL statements in the search feature. An attacker could use this flaw to inject malicious SQL in to a query. It was discovered that phpMyAdmin did not properly handler certain SQL statements in the search feature. An attacker could use this vulnerability to inject malicious SQL into a query.

criterions.comment: phpmyadmin package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.9.7+dfsg1-1').
